intro: Sturmia habenarina, commonly known as the red-flowered sturmia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom during the rainy season. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. Its flowers are tubular and clustered in inflorescences, attracting various pollinators such as birds and insects. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
